admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated as satisfactory
            and project sustainability is adjudged as likely. Overall
            World Bank performance has been satisfactory, in that it
            maintained realism and flexibility, as its staff kept
            themselves focused on the project's development
            objectives. Similarly, Borrower performance overall has been
            satisfactory, which has resulted in the successful
            implementation of the project. Lessons learned include the
            following: Flexibility was the key to success in this type
            of project--a flexible approach was used in selecting and
            prioritizing areas for installing new sub-surface drainage
            or for their rehabilitation. Also, the Bank and implementing
            agency maintained flexibility in the program to reallocate
            resources to cover urgently needed areas, which arose during
            implementation. In the Egyptian context, the project
            implementation timetable should give full consideration to
            the length of time required between board approval and
            effectiveness because Parlaiment does not often ratify
            loan/credit agreements within a short period. Further
            institutional building is needed to computerize the design
            process, the operation and maintenance of the drainage
            system, and the monitoring and evaluation of drainage
            impacts. Crop compensation should be incorporated into the
            drainage installation contract to be paid directly to
            farmers to circumvent delays.
